instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R5280: What is R5280? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.R5281: What is R5281? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not detecting battery
threads.message:
Battery is good have tested with another board
<RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR> diode mode 0.502
<RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> 0.450
Replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
still the same
Pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R5261</RESISTOR> stays around 1.1v
Would this be SMC? reflow or new one?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not detecting battery
threads.message:
Post exact diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus (SMC 5 SMBus).
Also same for SMC 1 SMBus.

Before replace <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> you should test without <DIODE>D6950</DIODE>.
Last suspect is SMC.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not detecting battery
threads.message:
Hi mate im not with the board now, but the <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> are the SCL/SDA SMC 5 SMBus lines aren't they(sorry dont have schematics with me atm either)
<RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR> pin 2 0.502
<RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> pin 2 0.450
Also sorry i miss typed i ment Pin 2 <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> is 1.1v
Will check the SMC 1 SMBus tomorrow.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not detecting battery
threads.message:
So you have a problem on SDA line.
Remove <DIODE>D6950</DIODE> and check again the values.
Difference between SCL/SDA lines should be less than 0.5%...

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not detecting battery
threads.message:
You were correct once again
removed <DIODE>D6950</DIODE> and values were the same.
Replaced it and now detects the battery.
Thanks Legend
